extendedIngredients.name: asparagus
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 pound asparagus (I used 9 oz.), cut diagonally into bite size pieces

extendedIngredients.name: chicken broth
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/2 to 3 cups gluten free, low-sodium, chicken broth* (I used O Organics brand.)

extendedIngredients.name: prosciutto
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (3 oz.) gluten-free prosciutto (Boar's Head DigiCatessen brand is gluten free.)
metaInformation: (Boar's Head DigiCatessen brand is gluten free.)

recipes.title: Gluten Free Asparagus Prosciutto Risotto

winePairing.pairingText: Risotto works really well with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Cecchi Chianti Classico Riserva di Famiglia. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Cecchi Chianti Classico Riserva di Famiglia
productMatches.description: Chianti Classico Riserva di Famiglia is certainly the most representative wine of Cecchi. Produced only in years in which the grapes reach the quality desired it comes from the area of Castellina in Chianti. The color of excellent limpidity is of an intense ruby red. The aroma reveals broad and ethereal notes of ripe fruit and spices. The structure is elegant.

recipes.instructions: Preheat non-stick pan with oil and butter until melted.Add onion, garlic powder and basil; and saute until onion is translucent.Add rice; stir; and cook for about 2 minutes.Add wine and turn heat to medium-high.  Cook until wine has been absorbed into the rice.Lower heat to medium and add 1/4 to 1/2 cup chicken broth at a time and stir; wait until the broth is well absorbed before adding more.  Keep on adding more chicken broth until rice is tender.While rice is cooking, boil some water in a shallow pan, just enough to come about half way up the asparagus.Add asparagus once boiled.Cook for about 3 - 5 minutes (whichever tenderness you like).When you place the last water in, add some parmesan cheese, if you choose to use it.Saute the prosciutto in a small pan and add it to the rice.Add in the asparagus; and toss all together.If you did not add the parmesan cheese in the rice then top each portion or the serving dish with some.

steps.step: Preheat non-stick pan with oil and butter until melted.
Add onion, garlic powder and basil; and saute until onion is translucent.
Add rice; stir; and cook for about 2 minutes.

Add wine and turn heat to medium-high.  Cook until wine has been absorbed into the rice.Lower heat to medium and add 1/4 to 1/2 cup chicken broth at a time and stir; wait until the broth is well absorbed before adding more.  Keep on adding more chicken broth until rice is tender.While rice is cooking, boil some water in a shallow pan, just enough to come about half way up the asparagus.
Add asparagus once boiled.Cook for about 3 - 5 minutes (whichever tenderness you like).When you place the last water in, add some parmesan cheese, if you choose to use it.
Saute the prosciutto in a small pan and add it to the rice.
Add in the asparagus; and toss all together.If you did not add the parmesan cheese in the rice then top each portion or the serving dish with some.
